items.name: Stilton
items.description: A semi-soft blue cow's milk cheese produced in the Nottinghamshire region. A strong cheese with a distinctive smell and taste and crumbly texture.

items.name: Stinking Bishop
items.description: A soft cow's milk cheese with a mild and creamy taste. This cheese is washed in perry, which produces the distinctive and strong odor from which the cheese takes its name.

items.name: Cheddar
items.description: A hard cow's milk cheese with a sharp, crisp flavor. Produced in the Somerset region using techniques dating back to 1170.

items.name: Camembert
items.description: A soft and creamy cow's milk cheese, made from unpasteurized milk in the Normandy region.

items.name: Tomme de Savoie
items.description: An unpasteurized semi-firm cow's milk cheese from the Savoie region, with a mild flavor and a relatively low fat content.

items.name: Morbier
items.description: A semi-soft cow's milk cheese with a strong and creamy flavor and a crisp, bitter aftertaste.

items.name: Gorgonzola
items.description: A veined blue cheese, made from un-skimmed cow's milk. Firm, crumbly and salty, with a sharp bite from the blue veining.

items.name: Fontina
items.description: A rich and creamy cow's milk cheese with a mild and nutty flavor. Ideal in fondue or as the main ingredient in Fonduta, with eggs and cream.

items.name: Parmesan
items.description: Known in Italy as Parmigiano-Reggiano, this is a hard cheese with a granular texture which is produced in the Parma region.
